pages.raw_output:
<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 194, 220, 208]]<|/det|>
# MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 215, 356, 232]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Pure Mathematics 2 (P2)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 259, 460, 303]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: Answer Booklet/Paper Graph Paper List of Formulae (MF9)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 320, 390, 337]]<|/det|>
READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 351, 828, 367]]<|/det|>
If you have been given an Answer Booklet, follow the instructions on the front cover of the Booklet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 367, 722, 383]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 384, 326, 400]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 400, 497, 416]]<|/det|>
You may use a soft pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 416, 601, 432]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, highlighters, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 447, 284, 462]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 462, 907, 494]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 494, 590, 510]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 510, 606, 526]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 540, 606, 556]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 556, 756, 572]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 572, 440, 588]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 50.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 588, 907, 619]]<|/det|>
Questions carrying smaller numbers of marks are printed earlier in the paper, and questions carrying larger numbers of marks later in the paper.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 74, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 415, 92]]<|/det|>
Solve the inequality \(|x - 2| \geqslant |x + 5|\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 120, 97, 140]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 119, 905, 140]]<|/det|>
Use logarithms to solve the equation \(5^{x} = 3^{2x - 1}\), giving your answer correct to 3 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 136, 920, 155]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 183, 97, 202]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 183, 272, 201]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[410, 203, 588, 222]]<|/det|>
\[2\cos 2\theta = 4\cos \theta -3,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 226, 265, 244]]<|/det|>
for \(0^{\circ} \leqslant \theta \leqslant 180^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 227, 920, 245]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 273, 96, 292]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 273, 440, 292]]<|/det|>
The parametric equations of a curve are

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[356, 298, 640, 331]]<|/det|>
\[x = \ln (1 - 2t),\quad y = \frac{2}{t},\quad \text{for} t< 0.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 355, 156, 373]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 351, 348, 380]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = \frac{1 - 2t}{t^2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 356, 920, 375]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 393, 153, 411]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 392, 821, 411]]<|/det|>
Find the exact coordinates of the only point on the curve at which the gradient is 3.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 393, 920, 411]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 440, 96, 459]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[331, 445, 707, 625]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 642, 920, 694]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve \(y = \cos x\), for \(0 \leqslant x \leqslant \frac{1}{2}\pi\). A rectangle \(OABC\) is drawn, where \(B\) is the point on the curve with \(x\)-coordinate \(\theta\), and \(A\) and \(C\) are on the axes, as shown. The shaded region \(R\) is bounded by the curve and by the lines \(x = \theta\) and \(y = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 707, 153, 725]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 707, 416, 725]]<|/det|>
Find the area of \(R\) in terms of \(\theta\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 707, 920, 725]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 738, 153, 756]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 737, 705, 756]]<|/det|>
The area of the rectangle \(OABC\) is equal to the area of \(R\). Show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[443, 761, 556, 794]]<|/det|>
\[\theta = \frac{1 - \sin\theta}{\cos\theta}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 768, 918, 787]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 826, 149, 843]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 816, 920, 870]]<|/det|>
Use the iterative formula \(\theta_{n + 1} = \frac{1 - \sin\theta_n}{\cos\theta_n}\), with initial value \(\theta_1 = 0.5\), to determine the value of \(\theta\) correct to 2 decimal places. Give the result of each iteration to 4 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 851, 920, 870]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 680, 92]]<|/det|>
Use the trapezium rule with two intervals to estimate the value of

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[435, 98, 561, 144]]<|/det|>
\[\int_{0}^{1}\frac{1}{6 + 2\mathrm{e}^{x}}\mathrm{d}x,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 150, 537, 170]]<|/det|>
giving your answer correct to 2 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 151, 920, 170]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 191, 144, 208]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 183, 324, 220]]<|/det|>
Find \(\int \frac{(\mathrm{e}^{x} - 2)^{2}}{\mathrm{e}^{2x}} \mathrm{d}x.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 193, 920, 211]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 252, 96, 271]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 250, 920, 301]]<|/det|>
The polynomial \(2x^{3} - 4x^{2} + ax + b\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants, is denoted by \(\mathrm{p}(x)\). It is given that when \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \((x + 1)\) the remainder is 4, and that when \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \((x - 3)\) the remainder is 12.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 314, 153, 332]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 314, 373, 332]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(a\) and \(b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 314, 920, 332]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 345, 151, 363]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 344, 920, 364]]<|/det|>
When \(a\) and \(b\) have these values, find the quotient and remainder when \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \((x^{2} - 2)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 361, 920, 380]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 411, 94, 431]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 406, 151, 428]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 405, 710, 437]]<|/det|>
By differentiating \(\frac{1}{\cos \theta}\), show that if \(y = \sec \theta\) then \(\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}\theta} = \tan \theta \sec \theta\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 412, 920, 431]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 448, 153, 466]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 448, 295, 466]]<|/det|>
Hence show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[400, 467, 598, 502]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2}y}{\mathrm{d}\theta^{2}} = a\sec^{3}\theta +b\sec \theta ,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 504, 386, 523]]<|/det|>
giving the values of \(a\) and \(b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 504, 920, 523]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 536, 153, 555]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 536, 344, 555]]<|/det|>
Find the exact value of

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[368, 559, 631, 597]]<|/det|>
\[\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{4}\pi}(1 + \tan^{2}\theta -3\sec \theta \tan \theta)\mathrm{d}\theta .\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 567, 920, 586]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]
